meanings.definition: Remaining after the greater part or quantity has gone.
meanings.sent1: The residual sugar in the drink made it too sweet for my taste.
meanings.sent2: She found a residual amount of food in the fridge after the party.
meanings.sent3: The residual smell of popcorn lingered in the theater long after the movie ended.
meanings.sent4: His residual fear of spiders from childhood still haunted him.
meanings.sent5: The residual heat from the fire kept the room warm throughout the night.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a residue or remainder.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the residual effects of the medication on the patients.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the residual damage to the houses was evident.
meanings.sent3: The residual crumbs on the table attracted a curious squirrel.
meanings.sent4: Her smile left a residual feeling of happiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The residual paint on the canvas added depth to the artwork.
